info.title: PurrFect Spots API
info.description:
PurrFect Spots API helps you share and discover cat locations.

        ## API Versioning
        All endpoints are available under `/api/v1/` prefix.
        Legacy routes (without prefix) are maintained for backward compatibility.

        ## Features
        * üìç **Share Locations**: Upload photos of cats and their locations.
        * ü§ñ **AI Detection**: Automatically detect cats in uploaded photos.
        * üîê **Authentication**: Secure login via Email/Password or Google OAuth.
        * üìä **Pagination**: API-side pagination for efficient data loading.

Simple health check endpoint

post.description:
Exchange Supabase Session (from email verification redirect) for Backend Session.
Validates the Supabase token and issues our own secure HttpOnly cookies.

post.description:
Upload cat photo with location information.

Security features:
- Rate limited: 5 requests per minute
- Magic bytes validation for file type
- Input sanitization for all text fields
- Security event logging

The image is automatically optimized (resized/compressed) before upload to S3.

get.description: Test if upload endpoint is working

schema.title: Response Test Upload Endpoint Api V1 Upload Test Get

post.description:
Detect cats in images using Google Cloud Vision API.
Rate Limit: 5 requests per minute per user.

Analyze suitability of locations for cats using Google Cloud Vision.
Rate Limit: 5 requests per minute per user.

Analyze both cat detection and location suitability using Google Cloud Vision.
Rate Limit: 3 requests per minute per user.

Test cat detection using Google Cloud Vision (authentication required).
Rate Limit: 10 requests per minute per user.

schema.title: Response Test Detect Cats Api V1 Detect Test Cats Post

post.description:
Test location analysis using Google Cloud Vision (authentication required).
Rate Limit: 10 requests per minute per user.

schema.title: Response Test Analyze Spot Api V1 Detect Test Spot Post

get.description:
Get cat images with pagination support.

Pagination can be done via:
- `offset` + `limit`: Skip N items, return M items
- `page` + `limit`: Return page N with M items per page (page starts at 1)

Examples:
- `/gallery?limit=20&offset=0` - First 20 images
- `/gallery?limit=20&page=2` - Second page of 20 images

Get all cat images with optional limit (use with caution for large datasets).
For backward compatibility and map display.

Consider using the paginated `/gallery` endpoint for better performance with large datasets.

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Maximum number of images to return (default: 1000)
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: Maximum number of images to return (default: 1000)

get.description: Get all cat locations from Supabase (for map display).

schema.title: Response Get Locations Api V1 Gallery Locations Get

get.description:
Get cat locations within a geographic viewport (bounding box).

This endpoint is optimized for map views that only need to display
markers within the current visible area.

Args:
    north: Maximum latitude (top of viewport)
    south: Minimum latitude (bottom of viewport)
    east: Maximum longitude (right of viewport)
    west: Minimum longitude (left of viewport)
    limit: Maximum pins to return (default 100)

Example:
    `/gallery/viewport?north=13.8&south=13.7&east=100.6&west=100.4`
Search cat locations with optional text query and/or tag filters.

parameters.name: q

schema.description: Text to search in location name and description
schema.title: Q

parameters.description: Text to search in location name and description

parameters.name: tags

schema.description: Comma-separated list of tags to filter by
schema.title: Tags

parameters.description: Comma-separated list of tags to filter by

get.description:
Get the most popular tags used across all cat photos.

Useful for:
- Tag autocomplete in upload form
- Tag cloud visualization
- Quick filter buttons

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Number of top tags to return
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: Number of top tags to return

get.description:
Get a specific photo by its ID.
Useful for deep linking and sharing.

delete.description:
Delete a photo.

Optimized for performance:
1. Quick ownership check (fast DB read)
2. Scheduled background deletion (S3 + DB + Cache)
3. Returns immediately (202 Accepted)

schema.title: Response Delete Photo Api V1 Gallery  Photo Id  Delete

get.description:
Get all feature flags and their current status.

This endpoint is public and can be called by the frontend
to determine which features to enable/disable in the UI.

Get all feature flags and their current status.

This endpoint is public and can be called by the frontend
to determine which features to enable/disable in the UI.

Check if a specific feature flag is enabled.

Args:

Returns:
    Object with flag name and enabled status

schema.title: Response Get Feature Flag Api V1 Feature Flags  Flag Name  Get

post.description:
Toggle like on a photo.

Uses atomic database function to prevent race conditions.
Returns the new liked status and updated likes count.
Rate limited to 10 requests per 10 seconds per user.
Add a comment to a photo.

get.description:
Liveness probe - checks if the application is running.

This is a lightweight check that should always succeed if the
application is not deadlocked or crashed.

Used by: Kubernetes liveness probes, basic monitoring

Returns:
    200 OK if application is alive

Readiness probe - checks if the application can handle requests.

This checks critical dependencies (database) and reports on
optional services (Redis, S3).

Used by: Kubernetes readiness probes, load balancer health checks

Returns:
    200 OK if ready to serve requests
    503 Service Unavailable if critical dependencies are down

Detailed dependency health check.

Checks all external services and provides detailed diagnostics.
This is more verbose than the readiness check and is intended
for debugging and monitoring dashboards.

Returns:
    Detailed status of all dependencies

Basic metrics endpoint for monitoring.

Returns cache stats and basic service metrics.
This is a simple alternative for environments without Prometheus.
